poem:
### The Reawakening of Aubrey Williams

In a studio, forgotten,  
colors pulse with ancient heartbeats.  
Brushstrokes echo colonial whispers,  
abstract landscapes weaving futures,  
chaotic dances of protest.  
Guyanese canvases now reborn,  
unfurl like unfaded flags—  
new eyes see the hues,  
new stories in the frame.  
Art, once past, breathes  
with unyielding visions of now.
